Summary I possess over 20 years of high technology, executive level general management, marketing and business development experience preceded by 5 years of international strategic management consulting experience. I have significant international business and multi-national team management experience with emphasis on China, Europe and Japan. I am motivated by the challenges associated with trail blazing into new areas, engaging new customers, building up or turning around an organization, and doing things “we haven’t done before”. I bring a strong track record as a strategic thinker and leader who can deliver results, an excellent marketer, and a quick study for new high technology markets. My experience spans many markets including the semiconductor, PC, high performance computing, data storage, handheld device, automotive electronics, set top box, software, online web services, wired & wireless communications systems, and display markets. My email: RVV1 at PACBELL dot NET. Specialties:Managing corporate marketing & product marketing teams, P&L management, starting up & incubating new ventures within a corporate environment, assessing/entering new markets, spinning out new companies, aligning/building ecosystems, strategic marketing/planning, developing new products, building brands, negotiating/closing business development deals, increasing organizational efficiency/effectiveness, building/coaching teams, serving as a company spokesperson to the press and at industry forums. Summary Ed is drawing his more than 25 years experience in new business creation to become the founder of Arria Live Media, a new start-up that is building the Internet of [Media] Things™.​​ 
 
Formerly with Intel Corpotation, he developed new business concepts in Intel's internal incubator, the New Business Initiatives group. There he has specialized in the Internet of Things, digital signage, media content delivery, and computational photography. He returned to Intel in June, 2005.  
 
Prior to his return to Intel, he co-founded CineForm, Inc., a video technology company where he served as VP of Marketing for more than 2 years. Under his leadership, CineForm’s high-definition (HD) video technology became the leading solution for professional ultra high definition workflows. CineForm was acquired by GoPro in 2010.  
 
Prior to CineForm, Mr. Arrington spent nearly 12 years with Intel Corporation where he held a variety of marketing leadership positions. He developed Intel's Extended PC strategy and founded a $35M internal business to build consumer products consistent with that strategy. He drove standards in home networking and network access including DSL, Cable-modem and wireless technology. He has chaired the DMTF, an industry standards organization, and was a product manager for high-end fax/modem products. 
 
As an avocation, Mr. Arrington was co-founder and operator of Fedora AV, a professional live audio, video, and lighting firm providing services for business events, concerts, and community activities. 
 
Mr. Arrington received his MBA from the University of Oregon where he was salutatorian for his class, and a Bachelor's Degree in Business Finance from Brigham Young University. He holds two US patents for unique consumer product design. 
 
Specialties: Business strategies that generate growth; Internet of Things; professional audio, video, and lighting technologies. Summary Tim Kober is the founding principal of Cedar Financial Advisors, an independent, fee-only financial planning firm based in Portland, Oregon.  
 
Mission: Provide individuals and families with a trusted and enduring advisory relationship so that they may realize personal goals by achieving long-term financial well-being. 
 
Tim helps clients develop specific financial and life goals and then assists them in reaching those goals. Since the firm operates on a fee-only basis and does not accept commissions, Tim's advice can remain completely objective. Services include: 
 
1) Goal-based Comprehensive Financial Planning – advice is rendered in areas including cash flow and debt management, risk management, college funding, life and career changes, asset allocation and investment selection, retirement planning, stock option advice, tax planning, and estate planning.  
 
2) Investment Management -- Focus is primarily on asset allocation and ongoing investment management using sound, academically proven strategies. 
 
Specialties: Goal-based Financial Planning 
Investment Management 
Health Insurance Planning 
Retirement Planning
